refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns a generic MIDI message received by the MIDI IN port.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns a generic MIDI message received by the MIDI IN port

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para:
kstatus -- the type of MIDI message. Can be:
128 (note off)
144 (note on)
160 (polyphonic aftertouch)
176 (control change)
192 (program change)
208 (channel aftertouch)
224 (pitch bend
0 if no MIDI message are pending in the MIDI IN buffer

midiin has no input arguments, because it reads at the MIDI in port implicitly. It works at k-rate. Normally (i.e., when no messages are pending) kstatus is zero, only when MIDI data are present in the MIDI IN buffer, is kstatus set to the type of the relevant messages.

note.para: Be careful when using midiin in low numbered instruments, since a MIDI note will launch additional instances of the instrument, resulting in duplicate events and weird behaviour. Use massign to direct MIDI note on messages to a different instrument or to disable triggering of instruments from MIDI.
